candidates.title: Relicense under MIT and Apache-2.0
candidates.body: Relicensing the espflash project under MIT and Apache-2.0 licenses as agreed on #224

candidates.title: Move the bootloaders and stubs into a common resources directory, update dependencies
enable support for loader stubs (via --use-stub arg)
candidates.body:
adds a rough impl for loading flash stubs into ram towards #215 (and https://github.com/esp-rs/esp-idf-template/issues/48), enabled with the `--use-stub` argument so this is a strictly opt-in addition and doesn't change existing behaviour.

(for some reason `ConnectOpts` is part of `main::Opts` and `Subcommand::(BoardInfo|SerialMonitor)` which can be a bit confusing / seems like it should only be in the root?)

tested `board-info` and flashing with on my `esp32-pico-v3`:

```
> cargo run --bin espflash -- board-info --use-stub /dev/ttyUSB0
Serial port: /dev/ttyUSB0
Connecting...

Using flash stub
Loading flash stub for chip: Esp32
Write 3432 byte stub text
Write 4 byte stub data
Finish stub write
Stub written...
Re-detected chip: Esp32
Chip type:         ESP32 (revision 3)
Crystal frequency: 40MHz
Flash size:        8MB
Features:          WiFi, BT, Dual Core, 240MHz, Embedded Flash, Embedded PSRAM, Coding Scheme None
MAC address:       50:02:91:a5:80:48
```

```
> cargo +esp espflash --use-stub /dev/ttyUSB0 --monitor
Serial port: /dev/ttyUSB0
Connecting...

Matched SerialPortType::Unknown
Using flash stub
Loading flash stub for chip: Esp32
Write 3432 byte stub text
Write 4 byte stub data
Finish stub write
Stub written...
Re-detected chip: Esp32
    Finished dev [optimized + debuginfo] target(s) in 0.10s
Chip type:         ESP32 (revision 3)
Crystal frequency: 40MHz
Flash size:        8MB
Features:          WiFi, BT, Dual Core, 240MHz, Embedded Flash, Embedded PSRAM, Coding Scheme None
MAC address:       50:02:91:a5:80:48
[00:00:01] ########################################      16/16      segment 0x1000                                                                [00:00:00] ########################################       1/1       segment 0x8000                                                                [00:00:29] ########################################     305/305     segment 0x10000                                                               
Flashing has completed!
Commands:
    CTRL+R    Reset chip
    CTRL+C    Exit

���ets Jul 29 2019 12:21:46
rst:0x1 (POWERON_RESET),boot:0x13 (SPI_FAST_FLASH_BOOT)
configsip: 271414342, SPIWP:0xee
clk_drv:0x00,q_drv:0x00,d_drv:0x00,cs0_drv:0x00,hd_drv:0x00,wp_drv:0x00
mode:DIO, clock div:2
load:0x3fff0030,len:6660
load:0x40078000,len:14848
0x40078000 - __udivmoddi4
    at ??:??
ho 0 tail 12 room 4
load:0x40080400,len:3792
0x40080400 - _invalid_pc_placeholder
    at ??:??
entry 0x40080694
0x40080694 - _iram_text_start
    at ??:??
I (30) boot: ESP-IDF f0a3ccc 2nd stage bootloader
I (30) boot: compile time 03:15:29

```

(as an aside, it'd be really nice to have a logging framework in there for debugging etc.)

candidates.title: Check if a new version if available upon invocation
candidates.body:
Checks [crates.io](https://crates.io) for a new version at the time of invocation, and prints a message to the user if an update is available.

You can test locally by hard-coding in a version below `1.6.0`.

candidates.title: Bump dependencies and fix resulting build errors
Add support for flashing the ESP32-C2 (aka ESP8684)
candidates.body: Additionally does some refactoring to reduce duplication.

candidates.title: Update `crossterm` and remove the temporary bugfix from our monitor
candidates.body: Confirmed that the monitor still works on macOS after these changes. @bjoernQ would you be able to test this out on Windows when you get a chance please? (No rush)

candidates.title: Allow hex or decimal addresses to be passed to the write bin subcommand
Add partition-table subcommand
candidates.body:
Fixes #165 and fixes #163. It's quite pretty too:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1664/166118910-8050a029-be9f-47bb-bd2d-6760e4eec690.png)

This is quite a bit more than I bargained for but I think this makes sense as parsing of the binary stuff is also in esp-idf's `gen_esp32part.py` and that's Python so we can't have that!

I had to bump the MSRV to 1.58 but I hope that's ok.

candidates.title: Replace our naive monitor with espmonitor
candidates.body:
Draft as we need a new release of espmonitor once https://github.com/esp-rs/espmonitor/pull/41 is merged, but feel free to try it out.

One thing to note is that we can not longer control the output to the terminal, so I've removed the line_endings module, if we need this we should PR it to espmonitor.

Closes #147

repo.name: espflash
repo.description: Serial flasher utility for Espressif SoCs and modules based on esptool.py
